comment.author: 31039759@N05
comment._content: Are you sure this was taken by Phelps? I know Phelps took quite a few images of this wreck, but they are all labeled differently than this image. Additionally none of his images that I have seen (of this wreck) are sepia toned.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Hi JoniMakesStuff,

In early train wreck imagery, X's were used to indicate where injured people were found following the wreck. That may be what the x's indicate.

Best,
Effie

comment.author: 67908005@N02
comment._content: When adding this interesting photo to the Clerestory Coaches (Railways) Group, as only the picture owner can do this, please kindly geotag, where possible, to identify the location of this picture, for the benefit of many of the world wide members! In the new photostream layout, click on the "3 dots icon", and use action "Add to your Map". In case of need refer to Slides 2 & 3 in this set. Many thanks. .

comment.author: 67908005@N02
comment._content: For pictures of other US NPCS (non-passenger carrying stock), including TPO (Travelling Post Offices) in the Clerestory Group click here...... Adjust size to suit, the detail option gives descriptions.
